intro: Rubus bartonianus, commonly known as the Bartonian blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. The botanical features of Rubus bartonianus make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
